column4: Fedora 9 will have full-disk encryption, Windows Vista has BitLocker Drive Encryption, Mac OS X 10.5 "Leopard" has FileVault, wtf does Ubuntu have?
ubuntu has had full drive encryption from the alternate cd since gutsy at least.
I'm using it as we speak.
then why is it not on the normal cd, i got the normal cd, not the alternative cd, and i didnt have no full disk encryption
you're welcome to submit patches to get lvm and encryption displays in ubiquity to play nice.
we have it. Use the alternate cd.
